page.title: 19Other Churches.
page.content: At West Bay is the modern church of St. John built in 1936. This intimate building is known as the Fishermen's Church and has Holy Communion Services on Sunday at 9.30 a.m. and Thursday at 7.30 a.m. It is served by the Team Ministry, but there are a number of retired clergymen living in West Bay who give their services from time to time. The Congregational Church in East Street now houses the United Reform Church, and Methodists also worship here in a recently refurbished interior. It was built in 1662 and seats over 800 people. The Friends' Meeting House in South Street is the oldest non-conformist place of worship, built in 1697.
